issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Implementation Procedures
issues.description: While the Board Policy establishes comprehensive guidance for counseling services, there is no corresponding Administrative Regulation to provide specific implementation procedures, timelines, documentation requirements, and operational details required by law.

legal_citations.text: Requires specific procedures for confidentiality, record-keeping, and disclosure of student information in counseling contexts

issues.required_language: Administrative procedures detailing implementation of counseling services, including confidentiality protocols, documentation requirements, referral procedures, and staff training requirements.

issues.title: Missing Specific Procedures for Confidentiality and Record-Keeping
issues.description: While BP mentions confidentiality requirements under Ed Code 49602, neither document provides specific procedures for handling, storing, and disclosing confidential counseling information, which is required for compliance.

legal_citations.text: Information of a personal nature disclosed by a student 12 years or older is confidential and shall not become part of the student record without written consent, with specific exceptions for disclosure

issues.required_language: Specific procedures for: (1) Securing and storing confidential counseling information separately from student records; (2) Obtaining written consent for disclosure; (3) Documenting exceptions to confidentiality; (4) Training staff on confidentiality requirements; (5) Procedures for when disclosure is required by law.

issues.title: Missing Mandatory Reporting Procedures
issues.description: Neither document addresses mandatory reporting requirements for counselors when they become aware of child abuse, neglect, or threats of harm, which are legally required procedures.

legal_citations.citation: Penal Code 11164-11174.3 (Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act)
legal_citations.text: School counselors are mandated reporters and must report suspected child abuse or neglect within specified timeframes

issues.required_language: Procedures for mandatory reporting including: (1) Recognition of signs of abuse/neglect; (2) Immediate reporting requirements and timelines; (3) Documentation procedures; (4) Follow-up requirements; (5) Training for counseling staff on mandatory reporting obligations.

issues.title: Missing Specific Consent Procedures for Mental Health Services
issues.description: While BP mentions written parent consent is required for mental health services, neither document provides specific procedures for obtaining, documenting, and maintaining such consent, or exceptions when students can self-consent.

legal_citations.text: Specifies when minors can consent to mental health treatment without parental consent

issues.required_language: Detailed procedures for: (1) Obtaining written parental consent for mental health services; (2) Determining when students age 12+ can self-consent; (3) Documentation and record-keeping of consent; (4) Procedures when consent is refused; (5) Emergency mental health intervention procedures.

issues.title: Missing Specific Timeline for Career Counseling Notice
issues.description: BP states parents must receive notice "at least once" before career counseling beginning in grade 7, but doesn't specify timing requirements for adequate parent participation.

legal_citations.text: Requires general notice to parents before career counseling and course selection so they may participate in counseling sessions and decisions

issues.required_language: Specific timeline for providing notice to parents (e.g., "at least 10 school days before scheduled career counseling sessions") to ensure meaningful opportunity for participation.

issues.title: Missing Procedures for Student Access to Counseling Services
issues.description: Neither document specifies how students can access counseling services, scheduling procedures, or response timeframes for different types of counseling needs.

legal_citations.text: Implies students must have access to counseling services that generate confidential information

issues.required_language: Procedures for: (1) How students request counseling services; (2) Scheduling and prioritization protocols; (3) Response timeframes for crisis vs. routine counseling; (4) Documentation of services provided; (5) Referral procedures to external agencies.
